events.event_description: Natural gas futures trading began at NYMEX, establishing a market for hedging price volatility at the Henry Hub.
events.citation: The first natural gas futures contracts began trading at NYMEX in 1990, allowing producers, consumers, and financial traders to hedge against price volatility at the Henry Hub in Louisiana.

events.event_description: Natural gas futures market shows contango with prices projected to increase by 82% through winter 2025-26, driven by expectations of demand surpassing supply.
events.citation: The natural gas futures market is presently in contango. The market currently indicates higher natural gas prices for next winter (Dec 2024–Mar 2025), increasing even further (+82%) through winter 2025–26.

events.event_description: New LNG terminals are expected to come online, contributing to increased natural gas demand while production slows.
events.citation: In particular, we project that the natural gas surplus to the five-year (2019–23) average will decrease with slowing production, while demand will increase as new liquefied natural gas terminals come on line.
